text.p: The following are leading domestic stories in Portuguese newspapers.

- The Portuguese electricity utility EDP and its Spanish equivalent Endesa are preparing to make a strategic alliance which would involve exchanging stakes of one or two percent in each other's share capital, the paper said.

- Former Banco de Fomento e Exterior (BFE) managers are taking legal action against Banco Portugues de Investimento (BPI), which recently bought BFE, for not paying Christmas and holiday bonuses, a source told the paper.
- Loss-making ship repairer Lisnave expects an annual turnover of 30 billion escudos after restructuring.
- Three public sector unions signed a three percent pay accord with the government but two others rejected the deal.
- Communist Party (PCP) general secretary Carlos Carvalhas told the paper the Socialist Party (PS) had disappointed the voters who brought them to into government late last year.

- Cement company Cimpor remains interested in investing in Brazil and has its eye on Caue and Cimentos Serrana. The acquisition of these two companies would represent an investment of over 40 billion escudos.

- The commissioner of Lisbon's Expo-98 world exhibition Cardoso e Cunha expects the cost of the fair to rise by 32 billion escudos and he wants to raise the share capital of the company organising the event, Parque Expo SA.
- Data published yesterday by the National Statistics Institute (INE) shows business investments are growing.
